strings.clears-intro-get-started-prefix: To get started, add a Guild Wars 2 API key in the
strings.clears-all-accounts-hidden: All accounts are currently set as hidden in API key settings.
strings.setting-hide-in-loading-screens-descript: Do not show any windows in loading screens or the character selection.
strings.setting-short-encounter-names-descriptio: Show shorter names in the table instead of the official ones from the API.
strings.setting-check-updates-description: Check for updates every time the game is launched, and show a window with details if one is available.
strings.setting-unfinished-clear-color-descripti: The background color for cells with unfinished encounters.
strings.setting-finished-clear-color-description: The background color for cells with finished encounters.
strings.setting-clears-style-description: The layout style of tables showing your clears.
strings.setting-clears-header-style-description: The style of the account list in My clears. Useful if showing clears for multiple accounts. Does not affect the single row layout.
strings.setting-clears-show-table-headers-descri: Show top row of tables in My clears.
strings.setting-clears-show-table-row-names-desc: Show first column of tables in My clears. Does not affect the single row layout.
strings.setting-main-window-show-bg-description: Enable window background for the main window.
strings.setting-main-window-show-title-descripti: Show the window header of the main window.
strings.setting-keybind-window-clears-descriptio: The key for opening the clears window, used with the modifiers configured in arcdps. The numbers are virtual key codes, you can find tables on the internet. Leave empty to disable.
strings.setting-keybind-window-apikeys-descripti: The key for opening the API key management window, used with the modifiers configured in arcdps. The numbers are virtual key codes, you can find tables on the internet. Leave empty to disable.
strings.setting-close-window-with-escape-descrip: Close open windows by pressing Escape.
strings.setting-reset-style-modal-question: This will reset all your style settings. Are you sure?
strings.clears-no-public-data-yet: Data from the GW2 API is not yet available.
strings.clears-no-clears-data-yet: Clear data is not yet available.
strings.api-key-window-intro-first-key: Click the button to add your first Guild Wars 2 API key.
strings.api-key-window-intro: Add another Guild Wars 2 API key or select an existing key on the left side.
strings.api-key-guide-step2: 2. Create a NEW key just for this plugin
strings.api-key-guide-step4: 4. Paste the new api key into the textbox above
strings.api-key-guide-step5: 5. Click the Check API key button
strings.api-key-warning-permission-account-missi: The API key is missing the account permission!
strings.api-key-warning-permission-progression-m: The API key is missing the progression permission!
strings.api-key-warning-subtoken-url-missing-acc: The subtoken does not have access to /v2/account!
The subtoken does not have access to /v2/account/raids!
strings.api-key-remove-modal-warning: This key will be deleted. Are you sure?
strings.friends-not-implemented-yet: This is not implemented yet. It's coming in the future. Thank you for your patience.
strings.friends-api-key-sharing-warning: You might be thinking that you can just give your API key to a friend now. I cannot stop you from that, but please make sure to carefully read the section below as it is not safe.
strings.friends-api-key-sharing-data-warning: Keep in mind that friends who have your API key might be able to see more information about your account than you expect, especially if you enable extra unnecessary permissions.
strings.friends-api-key-sharing-impersonation-wa: Your friend can also use your API key to impersonate you in Discord servers or on some websites.
strings.friends-api-key-sharing-not-recommended: For this reason alone, I do not recommend to do this.
strings.friends-api-key-sharing-feature-will-be-: The planned friends feature will be significantly safer than this.
strings.friends-api-key-sharing-rules: If you intend to do this regardless, make sure to follow these rules:
strings.friends-api-key-sharing-rule-new-key: Make a new API key for each friend you share it with (so you can delete it)
strings.friends-api-key-sharing-rule-extra-perms: Do not give the API key more permissions than needed (account and progression).
strings.friends-api-key-sharing-rule-trust: Only share your key with friends you truly trust.
strings.friends-api-key-sharing-subtoken-intro: If you know how, you can use GW2 API subtokens to further restrict access to only some parts of the API (there are multiple generators online).
strings.friends-api-key-sharing-subtoken-endpoin: In that case, make sure to enable the following endpoints:
strings.friends-api-key-sharing-subtoken-account: /v2/account - used to show the account name
strings.friends-api-key-sharing-subtoken-perms: Also make sure these permissions are present:
strings.friends-api-key-sharing-subtoken-expirat: And finally, set an appropriate expiration date, subtokens cannot be deleted without deleting the API key they were made from.
